decks.notes: This deck combines aggressive creatures with disruptive spells to control the game and overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing a mix of powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Leovold, along with efficient removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Fatal Push, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure. The inclusion of card advantage engines like Narset, Parter of Veils and Ancestral Recall helps to maintain card advantage and close out games quickly. The deck also uses mana denial with cards like Wasteland and Strip Mine to gain control of the battlefield.

The key strategy of this deck is to control the opponent's resources while simultaneously developing a strong board presence. By utilizing disruptive cards like Collector Ouphe and Abrupt Decay, along with powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Leovold, the deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Force of Vigor ensures that the opponent's plans can be thwarted while cards like Narset and Oko provide additional value and card advantage. Overall, the deck is designed to disrupt the opponent's game plan while presenting a formidable threat on the battlefield.

This deck focuses on quickly casting artifact creatures and disrupting opponents with tax effects. By using efficient mana sources like Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb, along with powerful artifacts like Sphere of Resistance and Trinisphere, it aims to slow down opponents while overwhelming them with a swarm of creatures like Arcbound Ravager and Walking Ballista. The inclusion of cards like Phyrexian Revoker and Chalice of the Void adds further disruption, while finishing the opponent off with evasive threats like Fleetwheel Cruiser. This deck aims to control the game through its artifact synergies and aggressive plays.

The deck focuses on gaining control of the game through powerful planeswalkers like Dack Fayden, Narset, and Oko, while also utilizing disruptive spells and efficient creatures like Deathrite Shaman. It aims to take advantage of card advantage and tempo plays with cards like Ancestral Recall, Time Walk, and Force of Will, while also having access to strong removal spells like Pyroblast and Wasteland. The mana base is designed to support the control gameplan with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands for color fixing and utility.

The deck is focused on achieving a quick win by utilizing the Doomsday combo with cards like Street Wraith, Thassa's Oracle, and Demonic Consultation. The deck also includes various card draw and tutor spells, as well as countermagic like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its combo pieces. The mana base is optimized for speed and consistency, with dual lands and fetchlands to ensure the player has access to the necessary colors of mana. The goal is to assemble the combo and win the game before the opponent can react effectively.

The deck revolves around using Underworld Breach to cast powerful spells multiple times from the graveyard, creating a looping combo chain. By utilizing cards like Wrenn and Six, Deathrite Shaman, and Dreadhorde Arcanist for mana and card advantage, the deck is able to quickly assemble and execute its combo. The inclusion of powerful tutors, counter magic, and card draw ensures consistency and protection for the combo pieces. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's fast and efficient gameplay, allowing for explosive turns and quick victories.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Noble Hierarch. It also aims to control the game with powerful spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, while also utilizing card advantage through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Hullbreacher. The deck also includes powerful mana acceleration and fixing with Moxen and fetch lands to ensure a consistent and aggressive game plan against opponents in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the powerful combo of Doomsday with cards like Thassa's Oracle and Street Wraith to win the game quickly. The deck includes various tutors and card draw spells to set up the Doomsday combo efficiently, as well as a range of counter spells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo from disruption. The deck also includes some powerful restricted cards like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to gain an advantage. Overall, the deck aims to win the game through a quick and decisive combo.

This deck focuses on assembling the Dark Depths combo to create a 20/20 indestructible Marit Lage token. The deck utilizes cards like Thespian's Stage, Mirage Mirror, and Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth to copy Dark Depths and trigger its ability, along with cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Expedition Map to search for key pieces. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Sphere of Resistance and Sorcerous Spyglass to slow down the opponent while setting up the combo. Additionally, Karn, the Great Creator can be used to shut down artifact-based strategies and further disrupt the opponent.

The focus of this deck is to combo off using Doomsday to set up a win condition with Thassa's Oracle. The deck is filled with cheap cantrips and protection spells to help dig through the library quickly and protect the combo. It also includes powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to find key pieces of the combo. With the ability to quickly assemble the combo and protect it with counterspells, this deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to create powerful combos and win conditions by constantly casting spells from the graveyard. It also includes a variety of spells for self-mill, tutoring, card advantage, and removal. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds consistency to the deck by allowing access to key cards from exile. The deck aims to control the game early on with counterspells and removal, then transition into explosive combo plays to quickly win the game.

This deck focuses on a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and overpower the opponent. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Oko and versatile creatures like Tarmogoyf, along with efficient removal spells and card draw to maintain board control. The deck also incorporates artifact hate with cards like Collector Ouphe and Karn, the Great Creator to disrupt opponent strategies. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure while having answers to disrupt the opponent's game plan, making it a versatile and proactive midrange strategy.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard while generating card advantage and controlling the game with counterspells and removal. Lurrus of the Dream-Den provides additional recursion and value. The deck aims to set up quick combos with Brain Freeze or generate card advantage with spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise. With a mix of cantrips, tutors, and powerful spells, the deck aims to build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with its efficient and powerful plays.

The main concept of this Dredge Combo deck is to quickly utilize graveyard recursion effects to bring back powerful creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll and Prized Amalgam from the graveyard, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Cabal Therapy and Leyline of the Void. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and graveyard synergies, creating an unstoppable board presence and winning the game through a combination of card advantage and aggressive creature attacks.

The archetype of this Vintage 1 vs 1 deck is centered around milling the opponent's library using cards like Archive Trap, Ruin Crab, and Hedron Crab, while also disrupting their graveyard with Leyline of the Void and Surgical Extraction. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces, along with card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Treasure Cruise to maintain card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Ashiok, Dream Render further disrupt the opponent's hand and library, making it difficult for them to execute their game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing the card Paradoxical Outcome to generate massive card advantage and mana ramp by bouncing back key artifacts and drawing cards. The deck aims to set up a powerful combo using artifacts like Black Lotus, Mana Crypt, and Bolas's Citadel to generate mana and cast spells for free. With a mix of control elements like Force of Will and disruptive cards like Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to set up a winning combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.
